title: Aristocrat London
tagline: Ecommerce website for a clothing designer
content1: With over 20 years of experience in the clothing industry, my client decided to open his own British fashion brand. The requirement was simple: design and build an e-commerce site to sell men's and women's clothing and accessories online. The seemingly difficult project turned out to be interesting as this was the first time I had the chance to design a website with features that can only be found on e-commerce sites. It was a different project than before, which required a lot, although the end result is comparable to the websites of clothing brands on the high streets in the city centres across the country.
content2:
My client wanted a minimalist, black and white website design, similar to high-end brands. I have decided to use a monochromatic colour, to give it a simple, stylish look, in line with the colours in the client's clothing designs. This also enabled me to focus more on the layout and individual page components. Also, I found it easier to work with one colour.

I looked back into what I did for one of the UX modules during my studies at the university. We were tasked to design an e-commerce website that uses a mega-menu. Upon reflection, I did not see the point of having a large drop-down. Instead, I decided to build smaller dropdowns for each major category. When the user hovers over the link to the category page, they are presented with a list of subcategories and a thumbnail image, a teaser of what they can expect.

The site focuses heavily on the photographs of models, therefore I have decided to use HTML5 'picture' tag to load smaller and larger images for mobile and desktop devices. I made this decision because Google's guidelines recommend that every website should fully load within 3 seconds. Moreover, in order to optimise the site for Search Engines, I have added Structured Data to each product, so that each product is easily recognised by search algorithms.
title3: Fast and easy placing of orders
content3:
The website is packed with features such as a search facility, interactive dialogues, cross-selling features, filters and much more. What I really like about this website is the user journey to place the order. I have integrated Opayo's payments service to seemingly process payments using the server integration. The website even automatically detects the card type, which is really handy!

This could be a long case study, but unfortunately, nobody has time to read long essays. That's why you should just press the 'Preview Live' button to see the website in action!
